news.title: Seán Gallagher resigned from role at presidential hopeful Gareth Sheridan’s firm in row over $180,000 corporate box
news.summary: The former presidential candidate Seán Gallagher resigned as a director of Gareth Sheridan’s company in a row over a $180,000-a-year (€154,000) ­corporate box.

news.title: Dublin docklands development sold for €177m
news.summary: Spencer Place Residential, a Ronan Group development in Dublin’s north docklands, has been sold to Ardstone for €177m. The transaction is the highest-value residential investment deal in Ireland this year, and suggests a higher level of confidence in the sector.

news.title: Irishman dies in Ecuador prison after being held over six-figure cocaine bust
news.summary: An Irishman has died in Ecuador, where he was being held in prison following a €600,000 cocaine smuggling bust.

news.title: How a log chalet home led to a 10-year planning row between three siblings
news.summary: A 73-year-old woman who was granted retention for her log chalet home is locked in a planning dispute after her two brothers objected to the decision.

news.title: Our IVF story: ‘Our little girl would not be here if our last embryo didn’t take’
news.summary: I always believed that being a mother was a natural part of a woman’s life. I thought that my body would just automatically know how to make a baby. So when my husband and I faced hurdle after hurdle once we started trying for kids, it made me question everything I thought I knew.

news.title: Thousands of health insurance customers warned they could end up on more expensive plans as major insurer retires 22 plans
news.summary: People who have health insurance with Irish Life have been warned not to fall into a situation where they end up on a more expensive plan.

news.title: Ask a money coach: 'I got the dog when my partner and I split up but now she’s refusing to help pay with vet fees'
‘Too little, too late’ – Bono and U2 have finally come out in support of Gaza, but reaction in some quarters has been hostile
news.summary: Even with the polarising nature of social media, U2 may have been surprised by the forceful reaction to their most recent post on Instagram.

news.title: Rise in e-scooter crashes sparks brain injury warning as gardaí seize vehicles
news.summary: E-scooter accidents and the devices’ use in crime are on the rise, according to health care specialists and An Garda Síochána.

news.title: Irish holidaymakers committed to summer breaks abroad, despite soaring temperatures across Europe
news.summary: Irish holidaymakers are sticking with their summer breaks abroad despite record-breaking temperatures in some European destinations
